metadata.title: CVE-2024-47814 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Vim is an open source, command line text editor. A use-after-free was foundin Vim < 9.1.0764. When closing a buffer (visible in a window) aBufWinLeave auto command can cause an use-after-free if this auto commandhappens to re-open the same buffer in a new split window. Impact is lowsince the user must have intentionally set up such a strange auto commandand run some buffer unload commands. However this may lead to a crash. Thisissue has been addressed in version 9.1.0764 and all users are advised toupgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-47814` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-athena - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-athena-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-gnome-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-gtk-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-gtk3 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-gtk3-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-nox - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-nox-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vim package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm26').
